intro: Zeuxine abbreviata, commonly known as the short-stemmed zeuxine, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, which includes buttercups and other flowering plants. The plant features slender, hairy stems that are often branched and bear small, clustered flowers with yellow petals. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three leaflets that are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Zeuxine abbreviata thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky habitats.
